comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: See article "CONSUL OF ITALY IN PERIL AS BOMB SHAKES BUILDINGS" in The evening world, November 06, 1915, Final Edition, page 1 The buildings are still standing, see Street View

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: It's pretty rare that all the buildings in a century-old street scene are still there, mostly unchanged. The two buildings on the right (224 and 226-30 Lafayette Street) are pictured 6 months earlier when Italy entered the war in this Bain photo:

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Thank you artolog for identifying the street address in this photograph and the one above.  We will add it to the description of both of these images.
